description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

title.narrative: Democracy and Human Rights Fund (DHRF) Program

description.narrative: Democracy and Human Rights Fund (DHRF) Program supports the promotion of human rights. DHRF activities include but are not limited to the assistance for free press, the fight against female genital mutilations, the eradication of vestiges of slavery, encouragement of good governance. In short, DHRF resources are used for small, short-term, high impact activities with the goal of encouraging change. .

description.narrative: (Mauritania): .Through the USAID Tamkeen activity, the U.S. government will.continue supporting civil society and non-governmental organizations to work.with vulnerable Mauritanian youth and build social cohesion through positive.approaches for civic engagement and alternatives to violent extremism (VE)..USAID Tamkeen will build on the progress attained through previous youth.activities to address the vestiges of Mauritania's historic slavery system, the.continuation of discrimination of minority groups, and the large, unemployed.youth population. USAID Tamkeen will also strive to reduce pull factors that.drive youth and others to join violent extremist organizations (VEOs). USAID.Tamkeen invests in youth and women as change agents to engage in activism to.combat the spread of mis/disinformation. At-risk Mauritanians, particularly.youth, underrepresented ethnic groups, and women, are vulnerable to recruitment.by VEOs. This vulnerability to recruitment has been further exacerbated by.social distancing measures required to stop the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic.and the subsequent economic downturn. USAID Tamkeen aims to create mutual.understanding among the population by providing soft skills and leadership.training, dialogue facilitation strategies to reduce grievances, and building.social cohesion as a strategy to prevent VEO recruitment. USAID Tamkeen will.help counter the devastating effects of panic, fear, and isolation resulting.from disinformation that supports the malign and divisive tactics employed by.VE actors and entities. USAID Tamkeen is also aligned with Mission Objective.2.2 from the Mauritania Integrated Country Strategy: Citizens are empowered.through policies promoting education, youth development, abolishment of slavery.and its effects, and integration of refugees, stateless persons, and.marginalized communities..

title.narrative: Empowering Mauritanian Youth Through Education, Leadership and Self Improvement (EMELI)

description.narrative: USAID has launched an integrated preventing violent extremism activity, 'Empowering Mauritanian Youth Through Education, Leadership and Self Improvement' (EMELI). USAID's EMELI aims to promote market-driven vocational education integrated with thought leadership training to enhance pro-social decision making capacities of vulnerable youth while also opening job linkages and employment opportunities for them. The proposed activities will increase their civic engagement and leadership skills. USAID will support civil society organizations that promote youth focused social justice activities. USAID will also build the capacity of a youth organization to become a youth cultural center to facilitate exchanges, innovative expressions, and creative solutions to challenges. USAID's EMELI will have a steering committee representative of 4 government Ministries civil society, and private sector to monitor, advise and contribute to the activity's sustainability.

Provide goods, food, personnel, services, cash, vouchers, family tracing and other assistance to meet basic human needs in order to foster transition from relief according to principles of universality, impartiality and human dignity, as well as implement risk reduction and resilience activities within a disaster response context. This element should be selected when possible as part of an integrated, coordinated and/or multi-sectoral approach.

Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.
